description: Quick concept-check for chapter 5. Test your understanding of execution flow, tracing, and debugging.

questions.prompt: What does 'execution flow' mean in Python?

options.label: The order in which Python runs your code, line by line.
The speed at which your computer runs.
A type of variable in Python.

explanations.overview: Execution flow is the order Python runs your code, usually from top to bottom.

byOptionId.a: Correct! Python runs your code in order, line by line.
byOptionId.b: No, that's about computer speed, not code flow.
byOptionId.c: Printing is just one part of execution, not the flow itself.
byOptionId.d: There is no variable type called 'execution flow'.

questions.prompt: What does it mean to 'trace' a variable in your code?

options.label: Follow how its value changes as the program runs.
Make it print in all capital letters.

explanations.overview: Tracing means following how a variable's value changes as your code runs.

byOptionId.a: Correct! Tracing is about watching the value change.
byOptionId.d: Printing in capitals is not tracing.

questions.prompt: Why do programmers use print statements when debugging?

options.label: To see what is happening inside the program as it runs.
To make the program run faster.
To change the color of the text.

explanations.overview: Print-debugging helps you see the values of variables and the flow of your program.

byOptionId.a: Correct! Print statements show you what's happening inside your code.
byOptionId.d: Printing does not change text color in Python's console.

questions.prompt: You see this error: `NameError: name 'scroe' is not defined`. What should you do?

options.label: Check for typos in your variable names.
Delete all your code and start over.
Ignore the error and keep running the code.

explanations.overview: A NameError usually means you misspelled a variable name.

byOptionId.a: Correct! Check for typos like 'scroe' instead of 'score'.
byOptionId.b: No need to delete everything. Just fix the typo.
byOptionId.c: Ignoring errors won't fix your code.
byOptionId.d: Language settings are not related to this error.
